jparsec.graph.chartRendering

Interface Graphics

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AWTGraphics

    public interface Graphics
    The main Graphics interface to provide rendering support in different platforms.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Graphics.ANAGLYPH_COLOR_MODE
      The set of color modes for the anaglyph method.
      static class  Graphics.FONT
      The set of supported fonts for rendering.

    • Method Detail

      • drawLine

        void drawLine(float i,
            float j,
            float k,
            float l,
            boolean fastMode)
        Draws a line from (x0, y0) to (xf, yf), general method for antialiasing.
        Parameters:
        i - x0.
        j - y0.
        k - xf.
        l - yf.
        fastMode - True to use Wu method instead of java2d one.

      • drawStraightLine

        void drawStraightLine(float i,
                    float j,
                    float k,
                    float l)
        Draws an straight line from (x0, y0) to (xf, yf). x0 and xf or y0 and yf should be equal, otherwise a fast line method is called.
        Parameters:
        i - x0.
        j - y0.
        k - xf.
        l - yf.

      • drawStraightLine

        void drawStraightLine(float i,
                    float j,
                    float k,
                    float l,
                    float dist1,
                    float dist2)
        Draws an straight line from (x0, y0) to (xf, yf), for distances dist1 and dist2. x0 and xf or y0 and yf should be equal, otherwise a fast line method is called.
        Parameters:
        i - x0.
        j - y0.
        k - xf.
        l - yf.
        dist1 - Initial distance point x0, y0.
        dist2 - Final distance point x1, y1.

      • setColor

        void setColor(int r,
            int g,
            int b,
            int a)
        Sets a color from RGB components.
        Parameters:
        r - Red, 0-255.
        g - Green.
        b - Blue.
        a - Alpha value, 255 for opaque.

      • drawImage

        void drawImage(java.lang.Object img,
             float x,
             float y)
        Draws an image at (x, y).
        Parameters:
        img - The image object, previously read using getImage(String). For Java desktop it will an Image or ToolkitImage object.
        x - X position.
        y - Y position.

      • getAnaglyphMode

        Graphics.ANAGLYPH_COLOR_MODE getAnaglyphMode()
        Returns the anaglyph mode.
        Returns:
        Anaglyph color mode.

      • drawImage

        void drawImage(java.lang.Object img,
             float x,
             float y,
             double scalex,
             double scaley)
        Draws an image at (x, y), with a given scale in x/y. This method is designed to support drawing images in (almost) vector graphics format for scaling factors lower than unity.
        Parameters:
        img - The image object, previously read using getImage(String). For Java desktop it will an Image or ToolkitImage object.
        x - X position.
        y - Y position.
        scalex - Scaling factor in x axis.
        scaley - Scaling factor in y axis.

      • getImage

        java.lang.Object getImage(java.lang.String url)
        Returns an image.
        Parameters:
        url - The path of an image resource in the classpath.
        Returns:
        The image object. For Java desktop it will a ToolkitImage object.

      • getImage

        java.lang.Object getImage(int w,
                        int h,
                        int[] pixels)
        Returns an image.
        Parameters:
        w - The width.
        h - The height.
        pixels - the RGB colors of the pixels.
        Returns:
        The image object. For Java desktop it will a BufferedImage object.

      • getScaledImage

        java.lang.Object getScaledImage(java.lang.Object image,
                              int w,
                              int h,
                              boolean sameRatio,
                              boolean useSpline)
        Returns an scaled image.
        Parameters:
        image - The image.
        w - The width.
        h - The height.
        sameRatio - True to maintain the image w/h ratio.
        useSpline - True to allow using spline technique for resizing, in case the implementation supports it.
        Returns:
        The image object. For Java desktop it will a BufferedImage object.

      • getScaledImage

        java.lang.Object getScaledImage(java.lang.Object image,
                              int w,
                              int h,
                              boolean sameRatio,
                              boolean useSpline,
                              int dy)
        Returns an scaled image.
        Parameters:
        image - The image.
        w - The width.
        h - The height.
        sameRatio - True to maintain the image w/h ratio.
        useSpline - True to allow using spline technique for resizing, in case the implementation supports it.
        dy - Number of pixels to move the image down. In case of not 0 the output image will be of greater size, recentered in vertical.
        Returns:
        The image object. For Java desktop it will a BufferedImage object.

      • getRotatedAndScaledImage

        java.lang.Object getRotatedAndScaledImage(java.lang.Object image,
                                        float radius_x,
                                        float radius_y,
                                        float ang,
                                        float scalex,
                                        float scaley)
        Returns an scaled and/or rotated image.
        Parameters:
        image - The image.
        radius_x - The translation/rotation radius in x, it will be usually the width of the image * scale * 0.5.
        radius_y - The translation/rotation radius in y, it will be usually the height of the image * scale * 0.5.
        ang - Rotation angle in radians.
        scalex - Scale factor in x axis, after rotation.
        scaley - Scale factor in y axis, after rotation.
        Returns:
        The image object. For Java desktop it will a BufferedImage object.

      • cloneImage

        java.lang.Object cloneImage(java.lang.Object image)
        Copies an image.
        Parameters:
        image - The image.
        Returns:
        The copy.

        Returns:
        The set of pixels for the image.

      • getColorInvertedImage

        java.lang.Object getColorInvertedImage(java.lang.Object image)
        Returns an image with inverted colors.
        Parameters:
        image - Input image.
        Returns:
        The output image object. For Java desktop it will a BufferedImage object.

      • getColorInvertedImage

        java.lang.Object getColorInvertedImage(java.lang.Object image,
                                     boolean r,
                                     boolean g,
                                     boolean b)
        Returns an image with inverted colors.
        Parameters:
        image - Input image.
        r - True to invert red channel.
        g - True to invert green channel.
        b - True to invert blue channel.
        Returns:
        The output image object. For Java desktop it will a BufferedImage object.

        j - y0.
        k - width.
        l - height.

        i - x0.

      • drawImage

        void drawImage(java.lang.Object img,
             float x,
             float y,
             float z,
             double scalex,
             double scaley)
        Draws an image at (x, y), distance z, and with a given scale in x/y. This method is designed to support drawing images in (almost) vector graphics format for scaling factors lower than unity.
        Parameters:
        img - The image object, previously read using getImage(String). For Java desktop it will an Image or ToolkitImage object.
        x - X position.
        y - Y position.
        z - Distance.
        scalex - Scaling factor in x axis.
        scaley - Scaling factor in y axis.

                   boolean v)
        Enables inversion.
        Parameters:

        v - True to allow (force) vertical inversion.

      • getInvertedPosition

        float[] getInvertedPosition(float i,
                          float j)
        Return the inverted position for a given x, y coordinates.
        Parameters:
        i - X position.
        j - Y position.
        Returns:
        The inverted position if inversion is enabled and some of the x and/or inversion flags are set.

      • blendImagesToAnaglyphMode

        java.lang.Object blendImagesToAnaglyphMode(java.lang.Object leftImg,
                                         java.lang.Object rightImg)
        Creates an anaglyph image from left and right eye views. This method uses the method described in Conversion of a Stereo Pair to Anaglyph with the Lest-Squares Projection Method (2009), by Eric Dubois (for CRT/Plasma displays). The result is an anaglyph that can be viewed with a pair of 3d glasses with some color for the left eye, and another for the right one.
        Parameters:
        leftImg - Left image. Should be in RGB color space.
        rightImg - Right image. Should be in RGB color space.
        Returns:
        Anaglyph view in RGB color space, adequate for CRT/Plasma screens.

      • setRGB

        void setRGB(java.lang.Object image,
          int x,
          int y,
          int c)
        Sets the color of an image at a given pixel.
        Parameters:
        image - The image.
        x - X position.
        y - Y position.
        c - The color.

      • renderingToExternalGraphics

        boolean renderingToExternalGraphics()
        Returns if this instance is rendering to an external Graphics device for vector graphics, or to an image hold internally.
        Returns:
        True or false.

      • makeColorTransparent

        java.lang.Object makeColorTransparent(java.lang.Object img,
                                    int color,
                                    boolean fromBlack,
                                    boolean toWhite,
                                    int t)
        Transforms to transparent the color in a given image.
        Parameters:
        img - The image.
        color - The color.
        fromBlack - True to set as transparent all colors from black to the input one.
        toWhite - True to set as transparent all colors from input to white.
        t - Transparency level. 0 for fully transparent.
        Returns:
        Output image.

      • drawLines

        void drawLines(int[] i,
             int[] j,
             int np,
             float[] dist,
             boolean fastMode)
        Draws a set of lines connected.
        Parameters:
        i - The set of x points.
        j - The set of y points.
        np - The number of lines to draw.
        dist - The set of distances of each point.
        fastMode - true to use fast mode, but with less quality. In particular, stroke, transparency, and antialiasing are not supported.

      • drawLines

        void drawLines(int[] i,
             int[] j,
             int np,
             boolean fastMode)
        Draws a set of lines connected.
        Parameters:
        i - The set of x points.
        j - The set of y points.
        np - The number of lines to draw.
        fastMode - true to use fast mode, but with less quality. In particular, stroke, transparency, and antialiasing are not supported.

      • addToDataBase

        void addToDataBase(java.lang.Object img,
                 java.lang.String id,
                 int life)
        Adds a given object to the database. This is currently used only in getImage method, so that the image returned is the one hold in the database, without wasting time in reading the file or doing some image processing. Not recommended in Android.
        Parameters:
        img - The image/object to save.
        id - The identifier. Use the path set in getImage.
        life - Life time in seconds in the database. <= 0 to keep it forever.

      • clearDataBase

        void clearDataBase()
        Clears the elements in the database.

      • getFromDataBase

        java.lang.Object getFromDataBase(java.lang.String id)
        Returns an object from the database.
        Parameters:
        id - The identifier, for instance the path to an image in getImage method.
        Returns:
        The object, or null if none is found.
